creator: egiva@nomagiclt.com
text:
Try to open attached svg icon with svg viewer on Mac OS 10.4 Java 1.5_07. With
1.6  preview is OK
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at java.awt.image.DirectColorModel.isCompatibleRaster(DirectColorModel.java:1337)
	at java.awt.image.BufferedImage.<init>(BufferedImage.java:615)

creator: egiva@nomagiclt.com
cam@apache.org
text:
I can't reproduce this.  I'm using Java 1.5.0_07 on an Intel OS X 10.4.10
machine with the latest Batik SVN code.

creator: egiva@nomagiclt.com
text:
Checked with intel Mac - exception is still present. Idea is that with Batik 1.6
- icon is not painted at all, with 1.7 beta 1 - icon is drawn but not whole
(missing symbol at the center and exception is still thrown)

creator: cam@apache.org
text:
OK I tried it with the 1.7beta1 release, and I do get that exception.  Please
try with the latest code from the Subversion repository, as that works for me.

creator: egiva@nomagiclt.com
text:
If it will work - how stable it will be? Perhaps you are going to make some
final release in a few days?

creator: cam@apache.org
text:
After a bunch of bugs having been fixed recently, I would like to see another
release soon.  Perhaps in a month or so?  Still have a bit of testing to do to
ensure there aren't any regressions.
